issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E5%8F%B2%E8%AB%BE%E7%99%BB+ithome&newwindow=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25E5%258F%25B2%25E8%25AB%25BE%25E7%2599%25BB%2Bithome%26newwindow%3D1) ### Comment > AdGuard is unable to correctly handle Percent-Encoding (e.g., `%=` = `%25`, `&` = `%26`) under certain circumstances. > This issue arises when processing specific URLs or URLs that contain Chinese characters. > > For example, try searching for **"伺服器 ithome"** on `www.google.com`. > When opening the ithome website from the search results, the address cannot be entered properly. > > **Example URL:** > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1) > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1) > > By disabling protection for `www.google.com` via the **AdGuard browser extension** on **MS Edge**, the issue can be quickly resolved. > However, since I am using **AdGuard for Windows**, the problem may be related to features such as traffic filtering or HTTPS filtering. > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hon44mfz2f40gg0k884cgk0s0oc8woonsk3ndozrgg.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/5jf9uwkg3g0s0cgs8k8488cog48osg0cs47brtsmfk.png?nc=1)

comment.body: @ntnguyen1234 Be careful (or rather avoid if possible) in using `src` attribute, it can cause filters not to match on apps e.g. https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/205238#issuecomment-2888093322 as apps removes tags matching network rules by default. Also I prefer not to hide `本ページはプロモーションが含まれています。` here as it informs user that the page may be affiliated.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E5%8F%B2%E8%AB%BE%E7%99%BB+ithome&newwindow=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25E5%258F%25B2%25E8%25AB%25BE%25E7%2599%25BB%2Bithome%26newwindow%3D1) ### Comment > AdGuard is unable to correctly handle Percent-Encoding (e.g., `%=` = `%25`, `&` = `%26`) under certain circumstances. > This issue arises when processing specific URLs or URLs that contain Chinese characters. > > For example, try searching for **"伺服器 ithome"** on `www.google.com`. > When opening the ithome website from the search results, the address cannot be entered properly. > > **Example URL:** > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=伺服器+ithome&newwindow=1) > - [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1](https://www.google.com/search?q=%E4%BC%BA%E6%9C%8D%E5%99%A8+ithome&newwindow=1) > > By disabling protection for `www.google.com` via the **AdGuard browser extension** on **MS Edge**, the issue can be quickly resolved. > However, since I am using **AdGuard for Windows**, the problem may be related to features such as traffic filtering or HTTPS filtering. > ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/hon44mfz2f40gg0k884cgk0s0oc8woonsk3ndozrgg.png?nc=1)

I propose `no##.gdpr-wrapper:is([class~=top],[class~=bottom])` > > Very important to note: 90% of Norway's ≥200 regional news sites are heavily centralised within 2 news conglomerates (Polaris Media and Amedia), of which Adressa is in Polaris Media. > > Therefore, limiting the entry to just `adressa.no` *would not suffice*. You can all trust me on that. It *must* be all-`no` or plausibly general.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Не повторяется.
Попробуйте очистить данные браузера, обновить фильтры (подождите около одной минуты), затем откройте сайт.

issue.title: www.youtube.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973

comment.body:
As I see, safe search cannot be forcibly enabled by AdGuard DNS Family Protection due to their current solution of CNAME.
For instance, this rule for our Private DNS or AdGuard Home should help, but it does not. You can contact them and ask about it.
```adblock
|www.startpage.com^$dnsrewrite=NOERROR;CNAME;safe.startpage.com
```

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://comic.pixiv.net/viewer/stories/205127](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fcomic.pixiv.net%2Fviewer%2Fstories%2F205127) ### Comment > This is a manga site. > You can choose whether to arrange the pages vertically or horizontally by switching the read mode in the screen, but the problem occurs when you arrange the pages horizontally. > When DNS is turned off, the ads are displayed, so you have to click the "X" mark to remove them, but then the page fills the screen. When DNS is on, the ads are blocked, but the page remains small on the screen and cannot be made larger than it should be. > Is it possible to make it so that the page is displayed in a larger size when DNS is on? ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/gfpo0kdtuw0gwsc40kcwok4kwckw0skmiaw6ulyilw.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/5pvtfurj95c84g0kkwwo8sc88kkwwgc6tugxs7dxt0.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/57o3ugyn2ogs8w0cs0og8cw8cwggcco1mz2g9h5uwt.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.10 License type: | free Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `https://dns.adguard-dns.com/dns-query`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/dns/filter_1_ios.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

comment.body:
> Is it possible to make it so that the page is displayed in a larger size when DNS is on?

Yes, it's possible. Enable AdGuard Mobile Ads and make sure that `advanced protection` is turned on.

issue.title: 1 incorrectly written entry in AdGuard Base.
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [x] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [x] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [x] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [x] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

uBO 1.64.1b4

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other (specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://filters.adtidy.org/extension/ublock/filters/2_without_easylist.txt

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard Tracking Protection filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

Dandelion Sprout's Annoyances List, AdGuard Cookie Notices filter, AdGuard Popups filter

### Security

Online Malicious URL Blocklist

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

Adblock List for Finland, EasyList Lithuania, Dandelion Sprout's Nordic Filters, Dandelion Sprout's Serbo-Croatian List

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. One entry in AdGuard Base Filter seems to be incorrectly written, as it lists `script` as $-values twice.

The broken entry is `/^https:\/\/[a-z]{8,15}\.(?:(com|net)\/(?:\d{1,3}\/)?tag\.min\.js$)/$script,third-party,redirect=noop.js,script`. I propose it should be changed to `/^https:\/\/[a-z]{8,15}\.(?:(com|net)\/(?:\d{1,3}\/)?tag\.min\.js)$/$script,third-party,redirect=noop.js`

(Secondarily in the screenshot below: uBO's syntaxing requires backslashing `'` and `"` in RegExes in the past year or two, which affects the ibelieveCOM entry, and 3 entries in AdGuard Popups Filter for plausibleIO, for uBO users only.)

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4912312-58ce-465f-b339-f8a304039cc5)

</details>

Browser: Vivaldi

### Privacy

- [x] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
Noticed one in AdGuard Tracking Protection Filter too: `||wcs.naver.com^$~script,redirect=noop.txt,domain=smartstore.naver.com,image,media,subdocument,stylesheet,script,xmlhttprequest,other` has both `script` and `~script` in it.

One in AdGuard Popups Filter: `+\/status\/\d+/]x.com,twitter.com##:matches-path(/\/[0-9A-Z_a-z)#layers[style="z-index: 1;"]:has(div[role="dialog"] a[href="/i/premium_sign_up"][style])`. The `+\/status\/\d+/]` part doesn't readily make sense to me, and there's a square right bracket missing after `_a-z`

AdGuard Other Annoyances Filter: `[$path]fontanka.ru##.gridContainer > div[class^="grid"]:has(> div[class] > div.flickity-enabled)`. uBO does not support `[$path]` that I currently know of, so that syntax would need to be discarded during list version generation.

# ATTENTION

> [!NOTE]  
> YouTube changes their detection scripts regularly. That means that sometime you can face the detection message.
> If all the following instructions do not work, please **email filters@adguard.com** or wait until any update is available. 

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use another adblocker in the same time because using another adblocker can delay/lags the YouTube loading (e.g., AdBlock Plus and AdBlock)[^1] OR interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!CAUTION] 
> Please do not use an userscript related to the bypassing YouTube detection message like [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing).
> Recently, YouTube anti-adblock script added infinite dummy advertisements to try to neutralize the userscript. ( [TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing#264](https://github.com/TheRealJoelmatic/RemoveAdblockThing/issues/264) )

> [!WARNING]
> Please check that there no another web browser extension that has adblocking feature is enabled on your web browser. It can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.

> [!IMPORTANT]  
> Saving memory feature of your web browser or sleep feature of your operating system can interfere AdGuard's filtering functionality.
> In this case, please re-enable AdGuard's filtering by toggling the protection toggle.
> Following the instructions can be needed.

### The instructions
1. Force to update the filters by clicking the reload button in AdGuard Browser Extension/AdGuard mobile or update tray menu in your system tray. [^2]
2. Reload the YouTube webpage without cache by pressing <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd> [^3].
3. Clear cache, cookies and site data of your web browser.
4. Re-open your web browser completely (checking your system monitor[^4] will be better).

[^1]: https://gitlab.com/adblockinc/ext/adblockplus/adblockplusui/-/issues/1576
[^2]: [AdGuard for Windows](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-windows/overview/#tray-menu); [AdGuard for Mac](https://adguard.com/kb/adguard-for-mac/overview/#updates-check); 
[^3]: On macOS, <kbd>Command</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>R</kbd>
[^4]: Task Manager on Windows, System Monitor on GNOME Shell, KDE System Guard on KDE Plasma or Activity Monitor on macOS. 


Previous issue https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/198973
